solution.text:
Let \(p(x)=x^2 - _{{j+k}}_x + _{{j*k}}_\).
Now if \(p(x)=(x-a)(x-b)\),
We can say that \(a \times b = _{{j*k}}_\)
To find the factors of \(p(x)\,\) we must find the factors of \(_{{j*k}}_\).
\(_{{j*k}}_=_{j}_ \times _{k}_\)
Now, \(p(_{j}_)=_{j}_^2 - (_{{j+k}}_ \times _{j}_) + _{{j*k}}_=_{{(j**2) -((j+k)*j) + (j*k)}}_\)
Also, \(p(_{k}_)=_{k}_^2 - (_{{j+k}}_ \times _{k}_) + _{{j*k}}_=_{{(k**2) -((j+k)*k) + (j*k)}}_\)
Therefore, \((x-_{j}_)\,\) and \((x-_{k}_)\,\) are the factors of \(p(x)\).
